dict.string: Check who is streaming on Twitch.tv and watch your favorite stream via Livestreamer on VLC or mpv.
List current TOP live streams on twitch.tv.

PATH="/usr/local/bin:$PATH"
if [ `which livestreamer` ]; then livestreamer --http-header Client-ID=pq1763hfd37807lw0z8pqum3isqr4hd {query} high elif [ `which mpv` ]; then mpv {query} fi
Search live streams on twitch.tv (game or channel).

--on alfred_script(q) --try --do shell script "osascript -e 'id of app \"Alfred 3\"'" --tell application "Alfred 3" to search "twbygame " & q --end try --end alfred_script
on alfred_script(q)
-- use Alfred 3 if exists, otherwise Alfred 2
set isAlfred3 to false try do shell script "osascript -e 'id of app \"Alfred 3\"'" set isAlfred3 to true end try
if isAlfred3 then tell application "Alfred 3" to search "twbygame " & q else tell application "Alfred 2" to search "twbygame " & q end if
end alfred_script
List current TOP streamed games on twitch.tv.
Searching and downloading game icons/covers... Please wait it takes some time (about 1 minute)...

keywords and description: ———————————————————————————————— twtop = top live streams on twitch.tv (sorted by number of viewers) twgames = top streamed games on twitch.tv (sorted by number of viewers) tw = search for a specific stream (game or streamer/channel)
optional: twbygame = twgames uses it to search for streamer by specific game twcover = search and download game icons/covers (e.g. do this if you deleted your images folder)
examples: ———————————————————————————————— ‚twtop’
‚tw warcraft‘ (searches for streams of „world of warcraft“ or „warcraft3“ as well as streams of a streamer who is called like „warcraftBoy“ or its stream title contains „warcraft“)
‚twgames‘
‚twbygame League Of Legends‚ (searches for streams of „league of legends“ only)
‚twcover‘
